elements.title: a coffin carriage used in British state funerals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a coffin carriage used in British state funerals (pictured) has been pulled by sailors since an incident at Queen Victoria's funeral in 1901?

elements.title: James O'Donnell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Westminster Abbey's director of music James O'Donnell, who is responsible for the singing at the state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II, is scheduled to become a professor at Yale University in 2023?

elements.title: first British monarch to make an official visit to Spain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1988, Elizabeth II became the first British monarch to make an official visit to Spain?

elements.title: Douglas Chandor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1952, Douglas Chandor painted the first portrait of Elizabeth II that she posed for following her accession?

elements.title: state hearse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elizabeth II approved the design of the state hearse used in her funeral?

elements.title: Leverton & Sons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leverton & Sons were given the coffin of Elizabeth II when they were appointed funeral directors to the Royal Household in 1991?

elements.title: Shaw Farm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that today's funeral procession of Elizabeth II to Windsor Castle will start at the gate to Shaw Farm?

elements.title: Queen's Road East (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1991 song "Queen's Road East" by Lo Ta-yu describes Elizabeth II as "beautiful even when saying goodbye"?
